summary: This is an email chain from August 2019 between attorneys Teri Gibbs and an Assistant United States Attorney, coordinating interviews for two clients who allege they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in 2004. The emails discuss scheduling in-person and video conference interviews and include a request to identify the clients in photographs seized from Epstein's home.

persons.name: Teri Gibbs
persons.context: Attorney coordinating interview schedules for two clients who are alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein. She is communicating with the U.S. Attorney's office.

persons.name: Colleen Mullen
persons.context: Copied on emails, appears to be involved in coordinating travel arrangements for a witness.

persons.name: Arick Fudali
persons.context: Described as the New York attorney who will accompany one of the alleged victims (Ms. [redacted]) to her interview.

persons.name: Lisa Bloom
persons.context: Copied on the initial email from Teri Gibbs to the U.S. Attorney's office.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (19 Cr. 490 (RMB)). The email states two clients believe they were assaulted by him in or around June 2004.

connections.description: Both are attorneys working on the same case; Fudali is described as the New York attorney who will accompany Gibbs's client.
Both copied on the initial email regarding victim reports, suggesting a professional association on the case.
Gibbs is representing clients who are alleged victims of Epstein, placing her in an adversarial legal relationship with him.
As the attorney accompanying an alleged victim to an interview with prosecutors, Fudali is part of the legal effort against Epstein.

events.title: Alleged Assaults by Epstein
events.description: Two clients of attorney Teri Gibbs believe they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in or around June 2004.

events.title: Scheduled Victim Interview
events.description: A scheduled in-person interview at the U.S. Attorney's office for one alleged victim (Ms. [redacted]), to be accompanied by attorney Arick Fudali.

events.title: Scheduled Video Conference Interview
events.description: A scheduled video conference interview (via Skype) for another alleged victim located in Japan.

locations: New York, NY 10007 (Southern District of New York U.S. Attorney's Office)
Okinawa (mentioned in context of time zone for video conference)
keyFacts: Two new alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein are identified, with assaults alleged to have occurred in or around June 2004.
The victims' attorneys provided photographs from 2004 and requested the U.S. Attorney's office to check if their clients appear in photographs seized from Epstein's home.
Interviews were being coordinated for August 26-27, 2019, with one victim in-person in New York and another via video conference from Japan.
The correspondence is part of case 19 Cr. 490 (RMB), the federal criminal case against Jeffrey Epstein.
Attorney Teri Gibbs, along with Lisa Bloom and Arick Fudali, were representing the alleged victims in communications with the U.S. Attorney's Office.
